name: AI Engineer
content:
About the job


We’re seeking an AI Engineer to drive the next generation of intelligent logistics solutions. This role blends machine learning, LLM-based automation, and agentic AI systems to transform drayage operations through innovation and intelligent process design.


You’ll work with state-of-the-art AI frameworks — including OpenAI’s GPT-5, Google Gemini, Anthropic Claude, and Google’s Agent Development Kit (ADK) — to build, deploy, and scale AI-driven features within PortPro’s connected ecosystem.


Key Responsibilities

AI System Design & Integration:
Architect and implement intelligent systems using LLMs, generative models, and autonomous agents (OpenAI, Gemini, Claude, ADK).
Agent Development:
Build and orchestrate AI agents for scheduling, route optimization, document automation, and customer support workflows.
Model Training & Fine-Tuning:
Fine-tune proprietary models with domain-specific datasets to enhance accuracy, reasoning, and contextual understanding.
AI-Driven Insights:
Develop predictive and prescriptive models to optimize operational decision-making across logistics workflows.
Cloud & API Integration:
Deploy scalable AI services on AWS, Azure, or GCP, integrating APIs from OpenAI, Google Vertex AI, and Anthropic.
Continuous Learning Pipelines (MLOps):
Implement automated pipelines for training, evaluation, and deployment using modern MLOps tools.
Collaboration & Research:
Work closely with product and engineering teams to integrate LLM-based features within drayOS and stay at the frontier of generative AI research.


Required Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
3+ years of hands-on experience in AI/ML model development or deployment.
Strong programming skills in Python and proficiency with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or JAX.
Experience building and integrating applications with OpenAI API, Gemini, Claude, or Google ADK.
Familiarity with LangChain, LlamaIndex, or other LLM orchestration frameworks.
Strong foundation in data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
Understanding of NLP, computer vision, reinforcement learning, or multimodal AI.
Experience deploying AI workloads on cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Proficiency with Git, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines for scalable deployments.


Preferred Qualifications

Experience in autonomous agent frameworks, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), or AI copilots.
Knowledge of AI ethics, interpretability, and responsible AI practices.
Contributions to AI open-source projects or research publications.
Familiarity with big data technologies (Spark, Kafka, Snowflake) and real-time streaming systems.
Background in building conversational or task-based AI applications using multimodal models.
